author: gl_past
title: CardanoTales: CNFTs-based RPG game.
description: CNFT collectibles have seen a wide success in the Cardano community but although the appeal, they can not yet be implemented in games.

assessments.note: What is a CNFT? Anyway, this project looks great. I can't wait to play this kind of game with NFTs. How will the game prevent multi-accounts and bots getting an advantage? These are two thing that can kill a game.

While the proposal qualifies as a new utilization of the Cardano blockchain and probably is a lot of fun and has the potential to bring on some new users and integrate a new use of NFTs, it does not qualify for the target of "providing the most value for end-users" compared to other proposals that are much more far-reaching.

The concept of a collectible NFT based game has proven to be successful on other blockchains and shown that they are very good at building communities around the game so this proposal addresses this challenge very well. From a game developer's perspective, I would love to work on a game built on Cardano and these types of projects will certainly also attract more game developers! The proposer states that they aim for battles to take place on the blockchain which is an interesting idea, but they only describe how this would work at a very high level. It would improve the proposal if these various game systems could be described in a bit more detail.

A popular game could in principle drive adoption of Cardano to a wider audience, however this project doesn't present the elements of what would make it unique, both as an interactive experience or as a blockchain technology. Apart form mentioning that certain elements of the game would be tokenised no mention of how these mechanics would work.
I would suggest rewriting the proposal with a focus on what would make the project unique and popular and thus drive adoption to Cardano.

The proposal fully addresses the challenge: a viral RGP browser game, if properly realized, can attract a lot of new users and open the Cardano ecosystem to the "entertainment" sector. The reference sector for games is undoubtedly relevant and above all aimed at a general public.
The use of CNTFs within the game is an important factor in terms of adoption and generated transactions.
If the game begins to be used it is inevitable that a volume will be created for the exchange of CNTFs in addition to what happens in the game.
The idea of ​​developing the entire battle mechanism directly in-chain gives even more value to what has already been indicated.

This game/dApp have the potential to bring lots of attention the Cardano. This kind of game can possibly attract lots of players and have a significant impact in the ecosystem. I would like to have seen more information about how the blockchain itself will be used to differentiate it from other off-chain games. It mentions that at first it would be a off-chain game and later on it would be moved to on-chain with more features, and this could be better explained. The website is on but there is not much information there. But in general, the idea is good and well aligned with the challenge objectives.
Information on a marketing plan would be good.

According to the self-description the team should be able to design a small indiegame and they have already started the process, which is a nice advantage and indication of dedication. Since no proper credentials of the team or the games they claim to have produced are provided however, only three stars. This rating will change if the requested information is provided in the comments.

The team described sound like they have all the necessary skills to successfully implement this proposal; They state that they have previously released games, it would help the proposal if they were to list them. The proposer also seems to have a clear vision of what they consider an MVP. However, I'm also concerned that the budget seems very low for what it is supposed to cover.

More information about the proposers previous games/projects and links to LinkdIn/CVs to get a better understanding of the team behind the project would have made it easier to predict the success of the proposal. A clearer description of game mechanics could have helped in anticipating the games' popularity and thus of the whole project. The budget requested is extremely small and the team should have mentioned other sources of financing or if none are available what's their plan to release a polished product.

All the general mechanics of the game are explained in a good way, however it would be great to add more specific information about the technologies that will be used for the developments: the mention of a "Javascript based editor" it is not clear enough, I would have liked to see which frameworks will be used, in which way the assets in the game will be tokenized automatically (using a central server? interacting with the users wallets? which technology will be used to interact with the central server or the wallets?).
Unfortunately costs breakdown are missing, but the funds requested are adequate for the general plan described in phase one.
It would be really helpful to provide more information about the team and the specific skills. At the same time the proposers demonstrated some of the skills necessary for the realization of the project (design of the characters, minting of example CNTFs).

Based on the stated team's experience, it seems that the project is very feasible and it might not be too difficult to meet the dates proposed there. Some points of the roadmap are already met, and it would be good to include information about them in the proposal. Also, based on the information available in the proposer's answers in comment section in IdeaScale, it seems that they really know what they are doing and that the proposal is completely feasible.

My biggest concern is the long-term funding for the game. I played EOS Knights, and loved it, but it turned into a rug-pull. I was so disappointed. Also, how will fees affect gameplay? Is $9,000 enough?
Seems like a simple game. What is the hook to get people to play it? How will it be marketed? What platforms will it be played on?

While the milestones are set well and comprehensible, auditable success criteria are set, there is no rationale for the budget/ no detailed assessment of the costs. Yet all in all the purpose of the proposal is clear and it is auditable.

The proposer has broken down what they expect to have accomplished in a set amount of time. They have started working on characters for the NFTs (which look great by the way!). It would be helpful to the proposal to state how many of these NFTs they hope to have done for their MVP and since they have already made some, they should have a good idea of the time required for each one. The current roadmap described is a bit confusing as it states that several things are ready, but does not provide them. There is not much information to be gleaned from the twitter feed or the provided website either.

Although members of the community specifically asked for this in the comments and they have indicated in the self-assessment checklist that they provided a broken down budget, the proposal doesn't include one, and I would highly recommend including one in a future iteration of the project. The requested budget is very small for developing a game on and it's unclear how it would be spent and how it should be audited. The roadmap provided is not detailed enough in the description of the planned steps to be able to properly anticipate the work that needs to be done to accomplish them and to audit the progress.

The roadmap is described in sufficient depth, including the time horizon for the future expansions.
The success of the project is clearly defined ("release of 1h lenght single player campaign demo within 3 months from voting / funding date") and I think it will be relatively easy to follow the development progress and assess it.
The missing parts that can definitely improve the rating for this criteria are related to the definition of goals in terms of user involved (e.g. set the goal to have 50 active players in the first 2 months). For the next phases it would be great to define a goal also in term of transactions generated / token minted and exchanged (the last sentence was not considered for rating because out of funding request).

The proposal lacks a budget breakdown in order to better understand how the money will be spent, and also some KPIs to measure the community engagement with the game. Besides that, there is a good roadmap with some already accomplished goals (which could have more information in the proposal as well) for the first phase of the game, which is really nice. It would be good to see some mapped risks as well. But the auditability of the proposal is overall good.

solution: We aim to address the lack of proper games with the development of a CNFT-based RPG game, where you can fight, collect and play with CNFTs.
experience: Our experienced team (computer engineer&SPO operator; physicist&game designer; pixel artist&art director) released indie RPG games earlier.
